team.unnamed.error

Class ErrorDetails

  • java.lang.Object
    • team.unnamed.error.ErrorDetails

  • public final class ErrorDetails
extends Object
    Contains a collection of Throwable messages thrown during a process. This details are mutable, you can add more Throwable messages and you can merge this error details with another ErrorDetails. Util for collect all thrown errors and not only print the first.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ErrorDetails(String heading)
      Constructs the error details using only the heading.
      ErrorDetails(String heading, Collection<String> messages)
      Constructs the error details with initial messages and a heading.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ErrorDetails add(String message)
      Adds the specified message to the list of messages.
      ErrorDetails add(Throwable error)
      Gets the error stack-trace using Errors.getStackTrace(java.lang.Throwable) and executes add(String) to add the stack-trace to the list of messages.
      int errorCount() 
      String format()
      Formats the error messages.
      ErrorDetails merge(ErrorDetails details)
      Adds all the error messages that the parameter "details" holds, returns an ErrorDetails object that contains all the messages (this.messages and details.messages), also uses this.heading and ignores details.heading.
      <T extends Exception>
      T      		 toException(Function<String,T> constructor)
      Constructs an exception using the current exceptions messages.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ErrorDetails

        public ErrorDetails(String heading,
                    Collection<String> messages)
        Constructs the error details with initial messages and a heading.
        Parameters:
        heading - The error details heading
        messages - The list of error messages

      • ErrorDetails

        public ErrorDetails(String heading)
        Constructs the error details using only the heading. Creates an empty list for the error messages.
        Parameters:
        heading - The heading

    • Method Detail

      • merge

        public ErrorDetails merge(ErrorDetails details)
        Adds all the error messages that the parameter "details" holds, returns an ErrorDetails object that contains all the messages (this.messages and details.messages), also uses this.heading and ignores details.heading.
        Parameters:
        details - The details
        Returns:
        The merged details

      • add

        public ErrorDetails add(Throwable error)
        Gets the error stack-trace using Errors.getStackTrace(java.lang.Throwable) and executes add(String) to add the stack-trace to the list of messages.
        Parameters:
        error - The error
        Returns:
        This error details, for a fluent-api.

      • add

        public ErrorDetails add(String message)
        Adds the specified message to the list of messages.
        Parameters:
        message - The message, not null and not empty.
        Returns:
        This error details, for a fluent-api

      • errorCount

        public int errorCount()
        Returns:
        The error messages count.

      • format

        public String format()
        Formats the error messages. The messages are joined into "\n" and enumerated. The heading is appended first.
        Returns:
        The formatted error messages, everything enumerated.

      • toException

        public <T extends Exception> T toException(Function<String,T> constructor)
        Constructs an exception using the current exceptions messages.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the exception
        Parameters:
        constructor - The constructor function. For example, creating a IllegalStateException: toException(IllegalStateException::new)
        Returns:
        The created exception
